one_reviews_text: verry fun to play i recomend it to everyone for a free first game is a verry fun time killer
This game takes what makes RTS games work and simplifies it, without removing the strategy, and definitely the best RTS game on VR. Now if you would excuse me, I'll go buy the game.

I have loved RTS games for decades. From Warcraft 3 to COH, Civilization , age of Myth, age of Emp, all of them. 
this game is the best I have ever played. 
it makes you feel powerful and you are in there commanding . and the units are amazing and the ,,,,ya its just unreal how great this is.
Im love it so much im goiong to buy it twice.

This game is awesome I can't get enough, it's generous that the free version includes a tutorial and unlimited online play plus a map and a AI character that you can also play unlimited times on easy or normal dificulty.

Pros:
- game lasts maybe 10 mins
- quite enjoyable and i come back to it often

Cons:
- not many online players, so you may need to wait 15 mins for a match.
- it seems it is not under active development anymore
Cant believe there is a free2play game this good, now Ill check what changes through buying the update
Its really the best game in store but i cant figure out how to queue with random people in solo building mode. I just can queue with people in the arena

review_title: Best vr game iv played yet (big But)
one_reviews_text: Lacking players and locked to one platform.. I hope they manage to build a bigger player base.

review_title: Download it and play PvP, it's free.
one_reviews_text: Try this game, you will never regret!

THIS GAME IS UNBELIEVABLE!!!!! A+++++++
It should SERIOUSLY win an Award! 
The attention to detail and polished game play is remarkable!
Hats OFF to the Devs and anyone evolved in making it happen!  :)

I love it and I play it almost every day and its fun but I haven't played with a lot of people lately. So if you read this please people get it its so much fun and quick match co op is so fun but not a lot of people are still playing it.

Ok so I've seen it on a video but i cant play it. I get in it and my hands aren't showing, the screen is frozen and my camera cant move. Please fix this

Please get back to me

I am absolutely stunned of how good this game is! It's a blast to play with a friend. Me and my best mate were hovering over the battlefield while watching how our little brass armies were killing each other in our name. Such a sight to behold!

Great game overall, definitely my favorite for oculus. I do wish that more people played it, because the wait time for multiplayer battles is a little long (1-5 minutes), but I noticed recently the wait time has been going down, and more are playing. I think a great addition would be some sort of leaderboard for the multiplayer battles to see where you rank. And upgrading individual towers for less, rather than all of that troop type, like if I want one archer tower fire and the other not.

great game to play, especially for free, very detailed, and it really gets you to stratigize all your moves...my only issue is when trying to battle dragons/wasps the difficulty to highlight them to cause an attack against an apponent is very hit or miss

Words cannot express.
Big Congratz for the dev team!

First time I have played anything like this.  I will buy the full game for sure.
Magic layout.  Very good!!!

its a great game only one problem it loves to crash after 30 mins in campaign.
other than that great gameplay awesome graphincs easy to learn.
Super fun game to play vs friends, endless hours of fun.
I did nt try it yet but I rate 5⭐ to thank you for the age of empire game

review_title: Great game!  Amazing content for free.
one_reviews_text: This is sort of combination of Stratego, Risk and Chess but on a much larger playing field, and in VR of course.  I have only played three skirmishes but I am hooked.  Will be getting the paid version once my brother-in-law gets his Rift set up.  We were both old school Risk fans way back in the day and Brass Tactics is a fantastic, contemporary extension of that.  Awesome work guys and gals!

What a great game!  Great visuals and game control.  UI is really intuitive with the Touch controls.  Working through the campaigns will take a beginner from being totally lost to fully understanding the game and how to play.  Becomming expert at the winning strategies and tactics will keep you coming back over and over.  Absolutely recommend this game for anyone with an interest in RTS.
Well done. Free .. I mean what else can you ask for. Its cool, fun and free.
I do not why after 15 min playing, the game just crash, i have 1060 gtx, i7 8700 and 16 gb ram
This game is a lot of fun, but it gets old after awhile. Also everytime I serch for a different mode other than one v one I just get stuck there.
review_feedback: Brass Tactics Arena is the free version. In the full retail version of Brass Tactics you can play additional maps and match on a second co-op map. There is also a weekly challenge maps available.

one_reviews_text: I LOVE THIS FAME inknow ia a have game but please PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PORT TO QUEST.....

The game is very fun. it is beautifully created ground up for VR. The game is so immersive, utilizing the Oculus touch hand movements in-game. They make everywhere from placing a tower to moving around the map using anchors feel like you are actually there commanding this place and panicking when your castle is under attack. I wish there were options to further increase the graphics, because even on ultra it is still pretty pixely which could be changed by allowing us to increase the resolution or AA. Hopefully more content will be added, BALANCED content to the full game. I will absolutely be buying sometime soon.

review_title: Great game, but there is a glitch
one_reviews_text: Me and my friend love to play together whether it is 1v1 or co-op but the person joining gets kicked after a few minutes. I don't know if it is your problem or ours, but please make an attempt to fix it . :]
I think it is an awsome game, but one thing is wrong difficulty for solo i would what to set the difficulty to easy for new players

This is the first time I have played a strategy combat game and even though it took me a little while to get the hang of it, once I did, it was really awesome!  Just take your time to learn how to maneuver around the board and move your players, before getting into a pitched battle.  Good graphics, good game play.
Its like starcraft but for VR and eaiser to use
Top Real-time strategy Game: Units and Squads + The Castle and Upgrades
I will buy it! I really enjoy.

I thought this game was really cool at first. Then someone explained to me that you get game breaking units that speed up your army movement when you buy this game that the users of the free version don't. Kind of makes the 1v1 matches completely one sided and pointless unless you get matched against another player who uses the free version. And it definitely doesn't make me want to support the devs by paying for this game.

Edit: 
Ok thanks, I didn't realize that I could change my presets. It's too bad the pallet customization isn't available but I'll take another look.
review_feedback: Brass Tactics Arena (free version) does have the exact same units that are available in the full game. The one thing that is not available in the free version is pallet customization. If you use the preset "Aggressive" pallet in the free version, you will have the units needed for the speed upgrades.  More information can be found in our Digital Manual: http://www.hiddenpath.com/manuals/brass-tactics-manual/

one_reviews_text: No clue about how this game is supposed to work. You move your hands and something happens and then something else, the playground swirls around out of control and then something else happens. Do a better job.
review_feedback: We've never heard of the game board spinning, but thanks for letting us know you experienced this. You can find additional tutorial info for the game here: http://www.hiddenpath.com/manuals/brass-tactics-manual/

one_reviews_text: A great game with lot's of strategy in both single, multiplayer, and co-op modes. Brass Tactics "Arena" is the free version of Brass Tactics; it comes with one map in each mode and has lots of replay value. If the free version doesn't quench your thirst for strategy and glorious victory, the full version will more than satiate the need to raise an army and leading it to annihilate your enemies. Definitely worth the download just to try it out.

The best strategic game at this time.
But to love it you have to love the strategy... each kind of strategy I mean, or it will be ripetitive for you.

This is a great stragetic and mind-boggling game, multiplayer and singleplayer! Although, considering that this is the free version there are alot of things locked and little to no maps to play with.  Still a very fun family-friendly game, and not much violence really, just fires and warriors perishing. I love the concept,  and the design it is just missing a few things.

This game is a lot of fun. I'll caveat it by saying it's fun for an early VR experience. If this game came out 4 years from now, it would get no attention and mediocore ratings. That being said, we're in early VR. If you want an RTS experience in VR, this is what you want and you won't be dissapointed.

It works very well, early and mid-game are a lot of fun, rock-paper-scissors method of combat is very simple and I feel like it lacks enough depth for later hours however it is a lot of fun. Midgame is where this shines, prioritising the right units in the right location against the correct enemies is very busy.
Very satisfying, fun to learn and the controls are just fantastic.

A really awesome game, but I am experiencing some issues in online versus. The game seems to desynchronize over time. When i talk to my opponent about the time he sees on the wall we observe several minutes of difference. The 'late' player won't be able to place towers, move allies, and so on. It's really annoying, it feels like a connection drop, but for some reason the game can't come back to a stable state after this. I hope you can find a solution to this, I really want to buy the full game but this issue is preventing me for the moment.
PS : My download speed is 1.5MB/s. The game is taking between 0.6 and 1MB/s at any time in the game.

review_title: What I've always wanted in an RTS
one_reviews_text: This brings Real Time Strategy games to a whole new level. Something I used to dream about as a kid... One of my favorite VR games!

Brass Tactics captures the all magic of Age of Empires, tailored perfectly for VR. It's the first VR game I've really felt was a great game. (Not just 'teleport here, shoot that' – but a detailed game, with intricate gameplay, that can compete with non-VR offerings.) The campaign is nice, although a little short. Where this game really shines, though, is with online PvP. Matches are intense and varied, and the community is friendly. (Hidden Path have been quick to balance units as the meta evolves, too.) The extra maps and ability to customize your loadout, in the full version, are well worth it.

This is a must play game.  Already pre-ordered the full version.  I'm not into playing other people so I like that there is a campaign and solo mode.  I hope they continue to develop the game after release, adding new maps or ability of players to make maps and upload for other users.  It would also be cool if they had other themes besides robotic.  I loved AOE 3 so I'd love to see little people and horses and ships in place of robots.  That would probably be another game or expansion or something though.  At any rate, I can't wait for the full release.

To be able to control your own minions into battle on a virtual table has been a dream of mine. Sure, this game may not be as huge as some other RTS games but the amazing feeling of seeing them moving in 3D space following your commands feels great. My only complaint is that people seem to have a tendency of leaving the game. Like common, play to the end. But this is not the game's fault of course. I will certainly buy the whole game when I get money.

This game deserves all the praise that it gets, as a veteren of Starcraft and Warcraft 3 this game has a surprising amount of depth. There is economic harassment, there are tech considerations, counters, builds, micro, macro, it's pretty much got everything.  The voice acting is also extremely well done which is something I normally skip. The only thing I'd like to see is matchmaking as I feel bad playing against newer players, and I don't really know how I stack up against other players.

It hurts me to give this game 3 stars, as I think it's absolutely beautiful and a step in the right direction when it comes to the RTS genre for VR, but we're still not quite there yet.

The controls are mostly great, navigating around the map and using the menus to get new buildings and upgrades feels incredibly seamless, but unit selection (especially when selecting multiple units) can be frustrating at times. Additionally, with the pre-selected build spots and the limited initial units you get, your early strategy is going to feel very repetitive. It's no Starcraft, but it doesn't have to be, but I feel the gameplay should be a little more varied.

I played as much as the demo allowed, exploring all unit types and strategies. I really wanted to like the game, but it's just an extremely primitive RTS that I know would feel like a chore after a while. Not for me, but it seems to be getting lots of 5 star reviews, so what do I know?

You can forget time once you start playing the game. I have the beta free version. Once you get connected with other players, it becomes very entertaining. They've fixed the disconnection issue and all seems good.  I wish it is possible to have a push to talk function. Nice to have, but not necessary.

One of the best VR games I have played so far, and the price is impossible to beat! 

A Real Time Strategy (RTS) game with pacing in between an Age of Empires and Starcraft/Warcraft.  Easy and intuitive mechanics for building sructures, as well as commanding units.

The combat begins with a simple rock (Warrior), paper (Archer), scissor (Cavalry) format, but quickly adds depth with unit upgrades that can reverse that flow of strengths.  Graphics are well done, with a lot of attention to detail on unit, map and animations (think of the opening of Game of Thrones when you build towers or upgrade yor base).

A very basic tutorial, and only one map for play against AI, but that is understandable since the rest is locked behind buying the full Brass Tactics game.  This however, still allows full features of Solo vs AI, co-op vs AI, and PVP, albeit with limited customization options.

Simplicistic, uninspired, technically poor. Gameplay gets old in a few minutes and there's really nothing about this game as you soon discover. It has nice ideas but it's just common practice of vr games to lack gameplay completely and Brass Tactics is no exception. It's not on par even with any oldest  RTS game on PC not in VR.
As always just because it's in vr doesn't means it's good.

This game is absolutely class! As a child growing up Age of Empires 2 was one of my favourite games. I loved it, but that was me as a child. i loved sonic too.. now-a-days that would be crap. I was afraid this would be crap. How wrong I was…, It was made for VR. It is unreal, its the best VR experience I have. Multiply is class (10/10), solo is class  (10/10), graphics class  (10/10). No idea why its free but I like it!! Age of Empires people you done it again!

The netcode / servers of this game is a disaster.
Now I have been trying for literally 20 minutes to start a game (around 20 failed matched), but each time I got the error message "lost connection to opponent".
I am aware that this is a beta test or whatever, but come one, 20 of 20 lost connection is insane.
When I get past the 1st 1 minute without disconnect, it always remains until the end if the game, but having 95% disc in the 1st 1 minute is crazy.
My connection is pretty fast and stable with low ping, I never have problems while playing Orbus, Pavlov, or Echo Arena.
review_feedback: We just completed an update to the game that fixed the disconnection and matchmaking issues you experienced.  Be sure to update to the latest version of the game before giving it another try.

one_reviews_text: Used to be play these types of games against my brothers. The controllers are cool and seeing their avatar is cool. Its fun. If you like real time strategy games this game is the best one for VR.

review_title: Best strategy game ever - thanks to VR
one_reviews_text:
The game may not offer a lot of ground-breaking new content and ideas, but simply puts everything perfectly together - and has great AI balancing. Even if you're not much into strategy games, do try this game - it's quite addictive and has a great tutorial. Controls are intuitive and because of the amazing VR, I have never - ever - experienced a better game within it's genre.
The game runs perfectly using supersampling at 2.0 on a GTX 1080 - graphics set to High. Ultra setting seems only to add FSAA, and there's no need for FSAA using supersampling at 2.0 (activated using Oculus Tray Tool).
This game is the new reference that future strategy games will be measured against.

This beta version demo is way better than many full games outhere, with easy to learn intuitive controls, brilliant graphics and addictive gameplay. Thank you! devs for the oportunity to play this great game.

i am lost for words, maybe not .. awesome, amazing, great art work gone into this and most of all banging game to play, the free game is pack with loads and you get to team up or play aganist others, not crash or had shuttering issue or lag ... try ... it is free this one ... why not, you'll be a fool not too ... i'm looking forward to what they bring next in this style ... time for another round :)

The game is fun. But the campaign will not progress past the 2nd training arena after victory. Played it twice and it still won't unlock stage 3.
Solo battles seem to work well however.
Update: Just noticed it may be locked until you buy it? If so then this is NOT indicated in the game at all. Also there does not seem to be any purchase options. So if this is an early access game then that is also not made clear. Update 2: After digging around google I finally figured out that it is not released yet. That was not indicated anywhere that I could see either. Apparently it's a demo at the time of this review.
review_feedback: Hi! Brass Tactic Arena is a smaller, free version of Brass Tactics. To play the additional maps and features you will need to purchase the full version of Brass Tactics from the Oculus store. Arena's content will remain the same and free after the full game launches.

one_reviews_text:
I was skeptical about this game. I saw some gameplay on YT but I didnt like it. But after playing a demo aka Arena game is really fun. The graphic is really good, game mechanic simple and intuitive. The Shareware version is pretty nice - coop, multiplayer and no time limit!
But still, when they make a game like a R.U.S.E.?

This review was update based on the fix that was rolled out for the matchmaking issues and the release of the full version.  I have not seen any matchmaking disconnects since the patch.

Overall this game is a blast to play.  Easy to learn the basics.  Controls took a bit of getting used to but by a couple games into it they start feeling natural.  Movement was very comfortable.  I'm not super sensitive to VR sickness but I do have some games I can only play for a short time, or on "comfort mode".  This didn't make me uncomforable at all.  I could play it for hours.  

If you like RTS games, at first glance, this may not seem as involved as the top non-VR RTS games but there are a lot of little nuances and strategies you can employ.  If you aren't into RTS games I'd still really recommend it as it is a bit simpler to pick up than it's non-VR competitors.  And playing this kind of game in VR is just awesome.  It basically has you hovering above a table building towers and moving units around to attack your enemies.

There are however a few things that could use some improvement.  These are however very minor and not enough to knock my rating down a full star.

It can be difficult to order your units to attack air units.  Yes they will attack them,   but if there is a group of ground units and air units it's too difficult to tell your forces to focus on the air units first.  This could just be me though.  Sometimes I get it to work and other times I just can't do it to save my life.

It would be nice to be able to select all similar units in a group.  For example if I have warriors and archers grouped up and I just want to select all the archers in that group.

The pointer seems off a bit when selecting things.  I feel like my hand has to be pointed down farther then it should to get my aim right.

I've been having so much fun with the full version of this game!  I feel like it's a must have.

review_title: Great throw back in greater depth.
one_reviews_text: If I was playing any other game with such horrible disconnect issues, I would of just stopped playing. But I just trudged forward. Game runs great, looks great, plays great. My only other loved rts is COH and AOE from the way back. And this successfully fills that little piece missing in that niche. All of the three are easy to play and tough to master, Ton of replay value with skills as payout instead of drop crates is something that has been long missed, Thank you.!Even with just one solo vs map, and one co-op. I can only imagine the full game being an even greater experience. The only issue I have found since the recent update would be the menu wobbles in the beginning and the wartable will also wobble in the beginning of a match or if you move the table up or down. It is like being on a rocking boat which is not good at all.

review_title: I hate RTS, but this one is mine!
one_reviews_text: This is the ultimate proof that VR is the solution and booster to everything. Now that I know what a revolution and pleasure this game really is, I would have paid a large sum of gold for this amazing giant 20x20 feet D&D miniature model table game. It feels so natural to play this game. You see much more than on a old 4k flat screen and you can interact much faster than a mouse/keyboard. Glad I chose the Oculus over the other inferior VR HMD.

review_title: The fee version = must have for RTS fans
one_reviews_text: It is fun to watch the little mechanical units, though I would prefer real units AoE style. Also, the fixed base positions make this game a lot different to AoE, worse experience in my opinion. I will buy the full game but only when the price drops below 20 euros or some very fundemental things change such as the fixed base positions. Currently, it is overpriced.

I was playing and I saw some really cool looking avatar  and colored tropps, so I thought to my self awesome. The man then spoke up but it wasn't him it was someone in the back ground talking about updates and statictics about the game.  He then proceded to wipe me...... as he proceded to do that he kept asking me "how do I like the game? Have I pre ordered it? ect." I tell him no and he says that " You know that the games price bumps up after tonight?". At this point I have suspicion that this guy is a dev on the game, so then he asks have I had any problems I saya few and he then resolves them with an unkanny amount of knoledge. So yes this game is amazing but just wanted to tell yall the story of " the time I was Wiped by a dev with Chavalry!" And Yes I have Now Bought The Game!

i played my first game with The developer Ted Warnock, a kind person. it was funny but unfortunately i had an issue with my computer  and got disconnected. I love the game and can't wait until february 22th .. It's very intuitive, easy to learn and nice graphics. I hope Brass tactics show the way to the others studios, i want more games like this one ! ;) greetings from France ! Ah et pour les anglophobes, le jeu est en Français !

review_title: How I have missed Age of Empires. Hope.
one_reviews_text: OK so it is by some of the people who produced age of empires. A good sign as that is arguably the benchmark for RTS. You start off with your base and expand from there. You cannot construct bases anywhere and have designated areas which you must infiltrate. This is a tiny bit of a worry as it does remove some of the freedom. However, for now I am happy to go with it until I have had more experience of 1vs1 or 2vs2. I say more... well I lose connection after about 30 seconds. Just enough to wave to my opponent. I wont mark it down for that as this is surely going to be sorted very soon and besides this is the free version. I am going to buy the full version without doubt and am really hoping for an Age of Empires like experience. 4v4 would be the ultimate for me and I'm sure that will come with time! I like the fact you have 3 types of setup, defensive, balanced or aggressive. It doesn't change that much, but kind of provides an age of empires type civilization choise. Hoping again for this to be expanded in the future.
review_feedback: Thanks for playing and for the review! We just did an update to the game and the disconnection issue you experienced is fixed.

one_reviews_text: The graphics are really nice. In this game you build as many units as you can and throw them at your opponent who has the same units and throws them at you. Whoever does that the fastest wins. I would very much like for someone to take these controls and graphics and make a strategy game. Like always....the potential is there but this is just not professional. (professional=good enough to pay for). As a free demo this is however great and it shows the potential of VR. But anyone knows that if the gameplay is lacking on a 2d screen making it in vr is not going to fix that. I will play this more when the netcode is fixed and update this review if my opinion changes but i doubt i will buy the full product. Pity but i am not going to support development by buying a vr game with gameplay better suited to an Atari 2600
review_feedback: We just did an update to the game and the disconnection and matchmaking issues you experienced are fixed.  Be sure to update to the latest version of the game before giving it another try.

review_title: Best RTS in VR so far
one_reviews_text: Designed for VR, high comfort and usability. Excellent game modes. Not overly complex, can be learnt in finite time. Short games, does not need a full day to play.

excellent graphics and details. very well built and epic sound. So far I like how the battles unfold, a quick strategy which can create a bit of imbalance, I think that the way the game is now is very good but I think that the game needs another game mode that you can better control the economy and last longer in developing econimia. which have 2 modes for you to choose between.

review_title: Amazing game, easy to pick up
one_reviews_text: How easy is it to pick up? Without any tutorial, i learned how everything worked almost immediately and wiped that smug look off my AI opponent's face. The controls are simple, easy to understand and the game is increadibly fun. Plus, it's free... why arent you already playing it?! (edit: That isn't to say there isnt any tutorial, i just jumped in feet first and decided to go for it. You can play the first two levels of the campaign and they teach you everything you need to know)

This is one of the best rts games ive played on the rift, none of the other ones even come close. I have already pre-ordered the full game, but the reason as to why this gets a 4 instead of a 5 is because of the connection issues to online games. This last day that i've played, every game that I connect to it says "lost connection" now I know this isin't me because I have played fine for days now with the occasional connection loss, but now it's everygame.

review_title: I normally don't like RTS or board games
one_reviews_text: But I like this game.  It's very polished.  Very easy to pick up and play.  Unlike many tower defense, RTS, or board games, in this game, you don't feel like you're grinding or doing work.  You're just having fun playing with toy soldiers and commanding your army.  It's all the fun of this type of game, none of the filler.  And it has very good visuals, animations, sounds, and voice work.

review_title: it stopped installing stuck on installin
one_reviews_text: what the duck.
review_feedback: Do you have Malwarebytes installed? There have been many reports on r/oculus of games not fulling installing when they have this program. Otherwise you can do a ticket with Oculus or email bugs@hiddenpath.com and our team can try and troubleshoot with you.

one_reviews_text:
The game pace feels just right.
The controls are pretty easy to understand.
The graphics are present

This is truly first FANTASTIC VR product worth recommending !

+ nice graphics, polished levels, enjoyable tutorial and narratives
+ very natural controls and game mechanics
+ easy to jump in, no steep learning curve
- if you don't have your VR legs yet, movement above the map can be a bit nauseous
 
I just preordered the full game.
Thank you, developers, for letting me to try it first!

review_title: Another of the same but prettier
one_reviews_text: Yea just played it for about an hour. Did the tutorial and played a game. Not impressed. I was hoping for an AOE type of game. They threw the "From the lead designer of Age Of Empires ll !" around enough that I thought that it would be at least close. No resource collection kills it for me. There are plenty of these games out there already, I was hoping for something different. ( Or the same as the AOE series) Im happy I didn't buy it.
Only recently got this on Beta, and it's absolutely brilliant. The polish in this game shows and I will definitely be buying the £20 version.
I have played Brass Tactics: Arena and I absolutely love it! I am looking very much forward to buying and playing the full version!

The one game I managed to complete was a blast. Really fun and neat. But every game I try to connect to after that just fails, or disconnects shortly after starting. It's a shame, because I think there's something special here if you can get it to work.
review_feedback: We just did an update to the game that fixed the disconnection and matchmaking issues you experienced.  Be sure to update to the latest version of the game before giving it another try.

review_title: This is one of the Game Changers in VR!
one_reviews_text: Beautifully designed for VR, absolutely comfortable and amazing gameplay. I want this game to be played by so many people.

Did a Preorder! you should do to!

EDIT: think about it add oculus Friends from Recent players! & add friend buton while at end of begning of a game, hope it helps!

review_title: Online matches are frenetic as C&C's
one_reviews_text:
Very well optimized for VR.
Mix of age and C&C.  It would be very interesting if there was an option to fog the unknown areas, like old school RTS games and another faction. Play against the same units with, maybe, some different upgrades is kinda OK.

Pretty good.  Someone have figure it out how to rotate with the oculus touch?  Great game so far.  Would be easier than turn on your chair everytime you want to go back at your castle. If it will be possible to use the top button in order to circle backward that will be great :)
really good game graphics and sound are good and well polished, hopefully campaign we be decent length..
I had a great time, this is the beset VR RTS currently available (the full version, I mean). This version has a lot of content for a demo, definitely a must-play!
This is a cant miss.. Very fun, Very addicting, and looks beautiful!!  The controls work great, and from the few maps I have played, they are fantastic!! A must play!!
Very nice game!! Funny, chanllenging, beautiful, translated to many languages, easy to play but difficult to master. Gives you the opportunity to think (not very usual these days). Try without doubt
I like this game as it does take strategy to play!I can't wait for it to be fully released. But, it is not easy playing online, without being disconnected after a few seconds of joining a match.
review_feedback: We just did an update to the game that fixed the disconnection and matchmaking issues you experienced.  Be sure to update to the latest version of the game before giving it another try.

one_reviews_text: Must play game. p vs ai is best.
I recommended this game its is out of the box on this game it has good graphics and good gameplay so a rate this a five star
Would I play this type of game on a flat screeen?  No fricking way.  Am I blown away by this in VR?  You bet!  I just hope they bring a WW2 version out; that would be awesome!!

review_title: may be the best game yet
one_reviews_text: 4 vs 4 would make this game THE STANDARD in RTS

review_title: I've never been so obsessed with a game
one_reviews_text: Perfect game, even with just two levels unlocked, I can't get enough of it. Never was a big fan of tactical games, but this is a game changer in VR!

review_title: The game that you have been waiting for
one_reviews_text: Every single cent of this game is well spent. The demo is absolutely mindblowing. If you ever thought of the step in table top games, that is the one.
This game is awsome ,  love sliding around table and i imagene it will be rather good fun tacticaly.   Well worth trying it out  :D
Best free game available (IMO). So good that I brought the full version and have been playing it since. Couldn't recommend it more.

Ok very nice, the issue seems gone =)
Now you get the 5 stars it deserves =)
Now give us slightly bigger maps, with 2v2 support =)
Try it and get hooked. Time to train your brains and outskill your enemies with normal warriors or even with titans. Visually stunning steampunk style.
just played the demo and now I'm really tempted to buy the game, just got to wait for pay day.

review_title: Game crashes while loading any level
one_reviews_text: I can't get the game to load a level. It crashes in the loading screen after I've hit start on a level. At the moment all this is for me is a fancy menu.
review_feedback: We just did an update to the game to fix the disconnection issues you experienced. Be sure to update to the latest version of the game before giving it another try.

review_title: Its an international game,its in Spanish
one_reviews_text: 5 stars because it is in Spanish, and it's not neutral Spanish, it's Spanish from Spain :)
I like it.  Nice smooth. Polished.
Let me ask this. 4 tanks and 3 arties vs 3 arrow. Who wins? arrow guys ofcorse?!?! f4ck this game.
I love RTS games and I was skeptical of a VR version but this game knocks it out of the park. Worth every penny.

review_title: Game is Awesome! Fix the campaign.
one_reviews_text: Amazing game! Mine just has a problem with the campaign where I can only play the first and second level.
Just wish the gfx or the animations were a little better. Its a bit difficult to differentiate between the buildings from a distance
this game is very fun and addiciting if it costed money I would buy it
the graphic quality is brutal! also a fun game
By far the best RTS in VR...

best RTS on VR!
If u like RTS... this is it!
worth every dollar.

review_title: A appreciated win and argument to go VR
one_reviews_text: Lots a fun.  I may keep my Oculus yet...
Amazing game must have for Oculus Rift.
Nice!!
fun to play

Have only just tried the demo, but having loved Age of Empires I had to give this a try. More enjoyable than Skyworld if you are just looking for a quick battle and don't want to worry about the resource collection and upgrade side of things. Really fun little game with great playability - will be very tempted to buy the full game!

So you go through the tutorial stuff, which is alright, but then you start a game and the entire thing is stacked against you.  I did a co-op against the computer game and the comp had over half of the area when we started and got super units within minutes.  Only the firs and second missions work in the campaign, too.
review_feedback: Brass Tactics Arena is a free demo of Brass Tactics. To play the full campaign, consider upgrading to Brass Tactics. As for the co-op map - yes, it's tuned a bit tough! Not all the levels are asymmetric like that one however. But people are beating it!
